meta.description: Miracle First Class Lounge at Suvarnabhumi Airport (BKK), Concourse D. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Miracle First Class Lounge

location.terminalDirections: From the Main Departures Level, proceed down to Level 3, the lounge is located opposite Gate D6.

location.description: Bang Phli, Samut Prakan, Bangkok, Thailand

lounge.description: Relax and unwind in the Miracle First Class Lounge prior to your departure from Bangkok. Enjoy a host of amenities, including a wide range of food and beverage, complimentary alcohol, and fast Wi-Fi.

general: Children 2 years old and under are admitted free with an adult.
regulatory: This lounge is only accessible for passengers departing on international flights.

reviews.content: Its OK, but the nearby Oman lounge is way better. There is alcohol and plenty of food, but it was dirty and noisy.
Good lounge. Some made to order food and a huge buffet. Not super crowded. Got a clean shower within 5 min. Self service bar. Gates are all FAR apart. Worth a stop here to relax.
Bigger lounge can be noisy. Big open kitchen making Asian noodle and rice dishes - fresh! Not much western food. Nice, quiet, staff. All around okay. There is sparkling wine in the fridge.
This lounge is far from first class. Food is basic buffet, there is no champagne, it‚Äôs really noisy. Never again.
Why this is called solid I don‚Äôt know because it‚Äôs a five star lounge and much much better than the Bangkok Airways in the same concourse.
FAR from ‚Äúfirst class‚Äù. There are not even glass walls to keep out the airport noise, the food is no better than cheap hotel breakfast. Chairs are comfy, bar is adequate.
After being EXTREMELY disappointed with Thai Airways' lounges, went exploring for better options. This one wins - hands down. Thank God for Priority Pass!
Good food. Good selection of drinks. Good design. 2 hour limit is not great. I did not like how noisy it was! It is just above the entrance to immigration so there‚Äôs a permanent swarm of people.
Open bar with self-pour, spicy delicious hot food options, fresh noodle soup made to order! Nice and spacious seating. Slow wifi 1.53 down/0.71 up.
This is a very nice international departure Lounge. Good hot food and a professional and courteous staff. Rick S. American Flyer ‚úàÔ∏èüåé
Not the best lounge. The food option is decent but not wide as others said. Many different drinks. Showers are huge and great. Staff is very helpful.
The lounge was very empty, staffs are friendly, 2 food and 2 drink areas, fast WiFi.
Surprisingly much better than the KLM/Air France lounge. Food selection is good, with decent Thai options. Pretty much empty at 23:30.
Could have better food. Workers should be fine but entering manually Priority Pass number, asking for the physical card when you have lost it is too much.
Highly recommend this one. Very pleasant shower area and decent food selection, plus good WiFi, quiet and airy. (Also definitely better than the economy-class part of the Bangkok Airways lounge!)
Lounge is great but 2 hour limit is annoying. They will find you.
Great lounge but the First Class Lounge is not 24 hours. Business Lounge next gate over is 24 hours but they impose a loose 2-hour time limit even when no one is in lounge.
Great lounge. Food is good. Great bar. Great showers. Great space. Recommend this lounge.
Great lounge. Spacious, self serve bar, showers, and large buffet.
Great lounge! Loved being able to get local eats such as pad Thai and Khao man gai. Spacious and friendly staff.
Excellent lounge across the board. Broad menu with fresh prepared dishes as well as extensive buffet area and drink selection.
The best lounge at BKK bar none (I‚Äôve been to all but the EK lounge). Great decor, staff, and food.
A truly impressive lounge, from the front desk staff, the amplitude of the lounge, the quality of the food at the buffet where you can order directly to the chefs. It is perfect for chilling.
Of the 30+ lounges I've visited in the last year, this is the best.  Top shelf booze, solid buffet and made to order food, ample plugs, very comfy seeking and top notch shower facilities.
Trumps the Oman lounge.  Showers are clean, food is perfectly fine, space is clean and modern. Only drawback is the 2hr time limit (PP used only??)
Solid food selection and clean spacious seating areas with a modern aesthetic.
Great little lounge! Nice and quiet except on the left hand side ...a bit modern and comfy.
Superb pay lounge. Plenty of room, spotlessly clean (sheepskin rug on the floor in each of the WC rooms - seriously), lots of food and snacks, and chefs cooking up food to order.
The best Priority Pass lounge at this airport.  Very spacious and modern. Good food selection. Showers available. Forget the other lounges and come straight here üëçüëçüëç
Real nice lounge with shower and good food. Even a cook there to cook you something if you want. Will come back!
Great lounge! Lots of space and good food.
Open air lounge to rest of airport so it's noisy.
They have a kitchen that makes hot food, Thai noodle soup with chicken, chicken rice, and omelet. There are alcohol here but I can't tell if it's for decoration or consumption tbh ü§î
Dinner spread had lots of options, and good drink selection.

Located in front of gate D6. Naming first class lounge, personalized service was just so so. They are 2 main sozes; relaxing and dining. 
Good decoration and almost empty. Limited F&B
Clean bathroom.
I came here early morning so the lounge is nearly empty. Neat and modern decoration. Breakfast is quite limited but not sure about other times of day. Plenty of drink options including alcoholic.
